Mumm er en helt fantastisk restaurant centralt i Roskilde. De tilbyder en gennemf√∏rt oplevelse af meget h√∏j kvalitet, hvor service, kundskab og passion v√¶gtl√¶gges. De kan sin mad, sin vin, og sin Gin Tonic :-) Vi vil altid komme tilbage til Mumm.

Spiste en uds√∏gt middag p√• Mumm. Vi valgte samtlige sm√• retter p√• spisekortet og delte dem s√• vi kunne smage det hele. Alt var rigtig l√¶kkert og tjeneren gav b√•de en personlig betjening og var meget vidende omkring den mad der blev serveret. Dette m√• klart v√¶re den bedste restaurant i Roskilde.

S√• dejlig oplevelse p√• Mumm. Sad i g√•rdhaven og det er virkeligt hyggeligt! Billederne lyver ikke! S√• behagelig betjening. Lydh√∏r overfor lidt √¶ndringer i retterne. Super l√¶kker og √¶rlig mad. Dejligt med en menu hvor man begr√¶nser sig til f√• men gode retter! Alle 4 var meget glade da vi gik fra Mumm! Vi ses helt sikkert igen

Vi bestilte Frit Fald til 1.265,- pr. person og fik fantastisk mad med sp√¶ndende vine til. Det undrede os dog at vi kom til at betale kr. 110,- for vand oven i menuernes pris, i en helaftens-menu som denne burde vand v√¶re inkluderet! Menuen bestod i overvejende grad af fisk og gr√∏nt - hvilket vi syntes var l√¶kkert. Er man til k√∏d skal man m√•ske v√¶lge noget andet - eneste ret med k√∏d indeholdt et meget lille stykke fjerkr√¶. Indretningen er moderniseret siden vi var p√• restauranten sidst - og det er lige til den kedelige side. P√¶nt, men meget anonymt. God afstand mellem g√¶sterne og fin hygiejne i disse tider...

Vi fik en seks retters menu med vinmenu. En mad -og vin oplevelse, som blev suppleret ved, at vi opholdt os i et rart og hyggeligt lokale. Hyggen var en del af oplevelsen. De to servitricer lagde yderligere oplevelser til middagen. De var opm√¶rksomme under hele middagen, uden at v√¶re generende. De serverede i et behageligt tempo. Vi blev orienteret om vin og mad p√• en god m√•de. De bidrog til, at det blev en helheds oplevelse af de gode.
Vi fik stort frit fald, og det var det hele v√¶rd. Betjeningen var fantastisk, og maden er perfekt. Kun de varmeste anbefalinger her fra.

Popped in for their lunch offer (109DKK) but as the saying goes you can‚Äôt get anything cheap.

Here everything was just appalling. Waiter lost our order, brought wrong food and finally when we got there food it didn‚Äôt have anything to do with Indian food.

We were 8 people for dinner and got to share:
-  4 starters...not to oily or large quantities, seekh kebab was sizzling nice, 
- 11 main dishes (all with rice)... ranging from sweet and buttery to extreme hot spicy
- 6 naans...potato, cheese, garlic they have it all,

On previous occasions we've picked up take away curries and had dinner at the Namaste, so our third visit was for lunch. An on the spot decision, encouraged by an announcement of special lunch offers and by the re-opening of restaurants in DK after a couple of months of covid-19 closure. The curries served were very good, veggies for her and lamb for him. The lunch deal includes a beer or a soft drink, so very good value. No doubt we'll be back when in town again.

Nothing exciting to say about the place. Typical Indian food, ok and ordinary. You would expect it to be cheaper, but it‚Äôs not! Definitely not a place to revisit. Waiters act like they couldn‚Äôt care less. 
A bottle of tap water 0,5 l is 25 kr (aprox. 3‚Ç¨), the cost of 1 liter of water for the restaurant is aprox. 40 √∏re which equals a profit of more than 10000 %. I guess that‚Äôs the punishment for not choosing one of their expensive drinks.

I ate here tonight with a colleague,  it's a good job we went early as it was packed on a Wednesday evening. The food was delicious..I had the sheek kebab to start and it came on a sizzling platter ..it was beautifully spiced and presented. I had the hot and spicy chicken as main, it was delicious with a rounded spice that didn't overpower the flavour of the chicken and sauce.
For an added touch of theatre, the hand towels we were given after the meal were rehydrated with warm water from a teapot!
Even the men's bathroom smelt nice with quality handwashing toiletries. 
I also discovered they deliver! They will be getting a lot of my business in the future I highly recommend this place.

As our trip to Denmark was winding to a close, a few colleagues suggested an Indian dinner to sign off and this is where we ended up. There were four of us and that allowed to explore quite a variety of stuff from mutton roghan josh to chicken tikka masala, veg pulao, paneer saagwala, and mango lassis. Well, the drunkard that I am, I had a cocktail, and I must say, I was incredibly impressed by the food and the cocktail! I'm a hardcore foodie and a critic and, given the circumstances, the food did well to please me! The meat wasn't merely boiled and dunked into the gravy, it was well marinated and tender. The gravy had the right amounts of spice - not too spicy and not spiceless! If I had to pick one criticism, it would be the use of excess food colour, but yeah, I'm still not complaining. 

Anyone in Roskilde or Copenhagen looking for decent Indian food, I'd strongly recommend this place.

No secret that Indian restaurants in Denmark often disappoint. This one meets UK curry expectations though it may not be straight out of Bradford or Leeds. The curries seem to come with rice included which is, I think, adapted to the Danish clientele. Everything is good, modern, professional, sleek even and the staff is lovely. The curries veer towards mildness so I'd say go for a notch spicier than you normally would. Naan breads were good and the pilau rice excellent. Sizzlers very pro. Very good lamb and acceptable chicken. Mango lassi did not disappoint. Fully licensed so no need to go without the usual Kingfisher or Cobra.
Price bracket higher than the neighbouring Indians but seating and atmosphere more opulent.

Gotta try out this place.. Super service, beautiful retaurant and nice calm indian authentic music teleporting you to a small felling of being in indian in the middlle of the super charming city Roskilde where you btw can enjoy icecreame or a cup of coffe after dinner or lunch.. well we had a awesome experience and i just needed to share it with you guys..

Hi.

I always look for places where the heart rules and it shows in the food quality and the attitude of those who work there. In Roskilde it is extremely hard to find a good place to eat, i have been far and wide, but i think i found one of the gems here. 

I hesitantly decided to try out a burger here as they have frozen yoghurt, for kids. Which to me shouts "baby and mouthbreather trap".  I walked in, read the description and was fairly impressed, and i tried it and wow, i was amazed by how the quality was shining from it, but i am not sure if it is true. It is a feeling and they do say it is organic. Thr bun is wholemeal and tasty which i always call for anywhere i go. And even the cheddar seemed real. The vegetarian steak tastes almost like meat a√∏evrn in consistency and it tastes amazing. 

If you had provided a detailed, easy to read ingredients list in respect for we who come and eat your food, i would have given you 5 stars.

Those who work there seems calm and friendly, and it feels like the restaurabt is actually owned by one participating in it actively and also in the food making. Perhaps that is why i almost shed a tear of happiness looking at it and taking a bite.

Fantastic place, sadly i cannot go there tonight to get dinner. It seems like they close waaay too early, but im happy they care for their own life and let us have it as a treat instead of overworking themselves feeding us;p

Thanks, i will be back, tomorrow. And i will get two;p

The little village Jyllinge is what we may say is off the beaten track in Denmark, but if you are visiting by car try this gem of a restaurant. A taxi from Roskilde is also an option. But once you are there, try to get table at the window, and you will have a magnificent view of the Roskilde fjord. The lunch menu is with the typical Danish choices, and you get a selection of beer to go with it. We had the traditional 'stjaerneskud', and I can only say that the taste of it all was absolutely fine. I can imagine that the other choices are just as good. We had coffee to round it off with  and on this late November day we visited, not many other people were there, so quiet and nice for a lunch conversation.
Menu consists of several fish and meat dishes (also a few veg.). Soup was great, main dish very tastefull. Especially the amount of different nice wines to choose, made the diner a enjoyable evening.
